intro: Tetrazygia aurea, commonly known as the golden spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Tetrazygia aurea thrives in well-drained sandy soils and full sun, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
